category: Member City/Provincial Sports Association Regulations/Article 10-2 (Demotion/Expulsion of Member Organizations)
contents: Article 10-2 (Demotion or expulsion of member organizations) ① When a regular member organization of a city/provincial sports association is deemed unsuitable as a member by violating the obligations of Article 10 (2) of the Sports Association's Articles of Association, the city/provincial sports association shall appoint registered delegates at the general meeting. A member may be demoted or expelled by a two-thirds vote or more. However, in this case, if the city/provincial sports association is a member of a member sports organization of the city/provincial sports association, the city/provincial sports association must notify and consult in advance, and in the case of a city/county/district sports association, the local government that has approved the establishment of the organization in advance This must be notified to the head and discussed with him. ② When an associate member organization or a recognized organization is deemed unsuitable as a member in violation of the obligations of Article 10, Paragraph 4 of the Sports Association's Articles of Incorporation, the city/provincial sports association may demote or expel the member by a vote of more than two-thirds of the registered directors at the board of directors. ③ If the city/provincial sports association intends to demote or expel a member organization pursuant to paragraphs 1 and 2, it shall give the organization an opportunity to explain itself prior to the resolution. Revised on May 10, 2022. ④ In addition to these regulations, the demotion or expulsion of member organizations of city/provincial sports associations shall be separately determined in accordance with the Sports Association’s ‘Enrollment and Withdrawal Regulations’. [This article added on October 6, 2021]
